captions.text: Hi, how are you doing?! My name is Otário (Sucker)...
And you know how much taxes the government collects each year?
In 2012, there were about 800 billion dollars (about R$1.6 Trillions)
And keeping this way, 2013 should easily beat this value!
[Debries falling from the roof]
Well, at least, with the money raised ...
The government and the state can offer: health care, safety, leisure, eduction, transportation and much more!
Woooow that's cooooool!
Are you kidding me that you believe in this bullshit?!
No, no, no, no, no...
Although the government provides: hospitals, schools, kindergartens, security ...
These services are so awful ... that I have to pay for all of them by myself
health insurance, private school, private security, theft insurance, toll, water, light,
gas, telephone, even the public transportation I have to pay, and pay a lot of money for a shit service!
According to the constitution of 1988 (88)
Every citizen has the right for housing
But even with your house or appartment fully paid,
if you do not pay the property tax, you may have your property auctioned! [Stamp]
I.e., every citizen is an eternal Government's Tenant!
Government! Want to help the people? Just do not mess up!
If it is to do that shit ...
I don't need yor help! Because I know how to take care of myself
And you know how much of your salary goes to the government?!
Let's imagine that u receive a salary of $2500 (Wooow! What a wealthy person! LoL)
On average, 20% of what you get, is directly deducted by the government
In addition ... you'll still pay about 30% on everything that you consume ...
That's what you get (being very conservative)
Because only in gasoline, it is charged over 50%...
Internet and telephone: 46% ...
TV sets: 45% ...
Restaurant: 32%
even to clean up your ass you have to pay taxes ...
Therefore, the $ 2500 which, theoretically, u get ...
Almost 50% goes to the government's pocket
And adding up about 40% of your gross salary that the company pays to keep you working...
The government had collected the incredible amount of $ 2,100
That is, 84% of your salary!
And do you know to where all this money goes?
Most of it is to pay the government's debt (50%) ...
social security (20%) ...
politicians and government' structure (10%) pdf ...
As a congressman, that works only 3 days a week ...
receives almost 13500 dollars per month,
and still have housing assistance, clothes assistance, gasoline, airline tickets ...
more than two months vacation per year and so on ...
Besides, of course, to finance the endemic corruption that exists in this country (10%)
Only a minimum percentage is applied to health care, education and other benefits to society ... (5%)
Stop! I want to drop off!
The amount of taxes paid by Brazilians is so huge, but so huge ...
That if we share the 800 billion dollars collected in 2012 among all Brazilians ...
every Brazilian family would have on average 18,000 dollars more, per year, to spend the way they want!
Can you wonder what you could do with this amount of cash?
Certainly, much more than the government does ...
But wait ... because there's more ... much more!
You know what can happen with you if you do not pay taxes? [closing bars, prison]
Yeah ... get arrested!
If a company provides a shit service or sells a bad product ...
You can simply boycott it! [Stamp noise: not buy]
But with the government taxes, or you pay, or you you ... and screw you!
Don't fuck with me!
But how to solve this issue?
Well .. There are many ways to solve this situation ...
One way would be through an armed revolution ...
After all, Brazil has 200 million inhabitants ...
taking out children and elderly people, we have about 160 million people ...
From these, less than 0.5% work to protect the government (between police and armed forces),
assuming that all of them are willing to defend the government (which would be very difficult to be true) ...
we would have a ratio of 1 against more than 300 ...
SPARTA!
Is that one person, even if it was heavily armed, could hold more than 300 people at once?
- I don't think so...
It's not the people who should fear their government, but it is the government that has to fear their people ...
But how many of you guys would actually be willing to do this?
[Gun]
This way, it gets complicated, huh champ?!
Another way would be evading taxes,
but it would only works if everybody works together,
but, as soon as half a dozen people get arrested for tax evasion,
the herd effect would take care of the rest. [Sound of elephants]
Even people knowing that would be impossible and impractical to arrest everyone.
Another solution would be a strike ...
If nobody works, automatically, there is tax collection ...
But it would hardly works ...
After all, in Brazil, everybody wants to be "smart" and take advantage of everything,
So, unfortunately, there are no quick, simple and miraculous fixes...
Probably the best solution ... is very slow ...
and requires a profound change in the population behavior,
because the politicians who are in power,
are just a pure representation of the Brazilian people ...
people accommodated, "smart", corrupt, people who don't like to work
and wants to take advantage of everything and everyone ...
while this kind of people exists... we will still have S.O.B. politicians...
So ... want to start a revolution?
The first thing to be done, is starting by changing your own behavior!
Then use the only weapon that democracy gives you, the vote ...
Vote consciously ...
To do this, just search for your candidate and stop being asshole and lazy...
saying that you don't like politics ...
Because, you might not like politics ... but the bandits and bastards love it!
Do you have any other solution?
Then comment it down here...
Help spread this message ...
Or, are you are those ones who do not make any shit
and just like to complain about the people who are trying to change something?
Did you like it? Then click the like button... Favorite it!

Woooow that's coool!
GOVERNMENT, do you want to leverage the brazilian economy?
So just cut the taxes, you S.O.B.!
And for those ones who want make a donation to Canal do Otário
It can be done following the instructions at the website: canaldootario.com (at menu: Contacts)
